intro: Helicta sarmentosa, commonly known as the creeping helicta, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that are typically clustered in dense, spherical inflorescences. It is a perennial species that thrives in well-drained soils and full sun.
